result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on August 13, 2014.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain full-time employment or education.

10/13/2014 AMENDED: COURT REMOVES THE CONDITION MUST MAINTAIN FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT OR EDUCATION.

Must complete an anger management assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

to Modify Judgment of Conviction. Defendant's.
8/8/14 Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Jennifer L Johnson in court with attorney Ryan Joseph Raymond.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State makes recommendation. Defense makes recommendation. 

State moves to amend count 1. Count to be amended to disorderly conduct 947.01(1). Court grants amendment.
Count 1: Defendant pleads guilty, Court accepts the plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
State makes recommendation. State makes recommendation. Court questions Defendant. 

Court relates and orders: 
SW
1 Year Probation. Must report to probation by 3 PM on 8/13/14. 
Defendant must maintain full time employment or education. 
Defendant must complete an anger managment assessment and comply with any recommended treatment. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Costs.

Defense pleads NG.

Defense wishes to proceed with Judge Bitney.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 2, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

1/17/2014: THIS BOND IS AMENDED TO ALLOW SUPERVISED TELEPHONE CONTACT WITH J.A.J. D/O/B 12-9-03 AND A.K.J. D/O/B 5-10-98. ALL OTHER CONDITIONS REMAIN IN FULL FORCE AND EFFECT.

Defendant Jennifer L Johnson in court with attorney Ryan J Raymond.  Joseph M Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 10:33: Detective Jason Olson with the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 10:38: Court questions witness. 10:39: Cross by Defense. 10:41: Court questions witness. 10:42: State makes argument. 10:43: Defense makes argument. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. Information filed. Defense makes bond modification request to allow phone contact with 2 children. State does not object. Court grants modification to allow supervised telephone contact with the children.  Arraignment scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Ryan Raymond
